The current Sharpe Ratio is slightly negative (‚Äë0.02), which puts us in the ‚Äústrict control‚Äù zone. We must limit new trades to high‚Äëconfidence (>‚ÄØ80) signals and keep the opening frequency to at most one new position per hour. Existing positions (ADA short and ETH short) have been opened only moments ago (0‚ÄØminutes held). Both are currently losing a small amount while the short‚Äëterm price action is moving against the short bias (price above EMA20, MACD turning positive, RSI very high). However, the rule requires us to hold positions for at least 30‚ÄØminutes before considering an exit, so we will keep them open for now.

Scanning the candidate list, every coin shows mixed signals: price is slightly above the short‚Äëterm EMA20, MACD is either weakly negative or turning positive, and RSI is in the overbought region. None of the setups reach the required confidence threshold of 80‚ÄØ% for opening a new position. Therefore, the safest action that aligns with the Sharpe‚Äëratio‚Äëdriven strategy is to **wait** and monitor the market, letting the existing positions develop while avoiding any new entries.

**Decision:** No new trades, maintain current positions.
